11111.content:
Drinking away, Nick was staring off the distance when he heard a female voice call over the barkeep.
Looking at who would sit near him, it was a beautiful skunk anthro wearing a purple skirt with a black shirt on their flat torso. The top wasn't much to look at, except for the pretty face and green eyes, rather it was their bottom that gathered attention. Hips twice as wide as the skunk's shoulders and an ass so big that it requires at least two chairs to barely hold each cheek, as it was spilling over the edge with ease. With thick thighs to toss in with the mix, it would drive most men wild, but something about the anthro bugged Nick and he patted on the shoulder to gather its attention.
"You're a dude, aren't you?"
The skunk looks at him for a while before cracking a smile.
"Impressive! All guys would assume that I was a woman until I told them otherwise. Let me get you something," he says, getting the barkeep's attention to order a drink for Nick.
"Name's Nick."
"Chris. So, what's with you being here in this pub?" He asks.
"Just wanted a drink. What about you dressing up as a chick?"
Blushing a bit, Chris soon replies.
"As far as I could remember, I have always looked like a girl and because of that, I eventually decided to dress up like one," he answers.
The two of you drink for a while as you both ask each other about yourself until you're both drunk and a growl comes from Chris's gut.
"Oh, I guess it's my time to leave. Don't want to gas the place out!" He giggles, catching Nick's attention.
"What you mean?"
"I have to fart and I been told that they reek badly," he giggles.
"Then, let me help you with that. Barkeep's, can I get some nachos and a glass of milk for my friend!" Nick orders.
"What are you doing?" Chris asks, curious about the human's actions.
"Trying to make you even more gassy."
"Oh my! But who will deal with this much gas?"
"You can leave that to me!" Nick states, a thin smile on Chris's face.
"Don't say I warned you or anything," he replies, just as the food arrives.
It wasn't long before he devoured it all and asked for more, exceeding at least seven large servings before paying for the bill. Paying his portion, Nick joins up with Chris and both head to Chris's place. Walking behind the skunk, Nick could see his new friend's butt quiver a each step he took.
"You know I could have eaten more if I had the money to so, but being an inventor doesn't pay much, so deal with it, sweetheart," Chris said, catching Nick staring at his ass and Nick could look back in disbelief at the thought of him eating more, as he ate a lot of food.
Once inside of the home, Chris releases a massive fart from his ass, jiggling his rump. Nick takes a whiff of it and cringes his nose.
"You're right about it being bad but nothing I can't handle," Nick said, before Chris's tail wraps around his neck.
"No, you gotta get it from the source," the anthro said, pulling up his skirt, showing off some blue panties on his large butt, and pulling the human towards his bottom, just as he's about to rip another one, nose first.
The fart came out loud and bassy, blowing back Nick's hair a bit. It was smellier than the last one, but Nick didn't mind at all, as he sniffed it all.
Releasing him, Chris turns around and says, "Right now, I'm feeling..."

11121212.content:
She was BIG.

Easily in the realm of over six-hundred pounds, the vixen sported a pair of two thick, flabby arms that were resting on the table top so she could lean forward to read her book. Squashed between her meaty arms were her voluptuous breasts, both bigger than watermelons with a thick helping of cleavage that was trying to spill out from her v-neck shirt. Pressing tightly up against the edge of the table was her massive stomach. The big ball of white and orange fur was as large as an exercise ball and stuck out several feet in front of her. Down below her thick hips and thighs were oozing out from under her in both directions, stretching her black leggings to the absolute limit and leaving no doubt in your mind they were as thick as the trunk of a tree if not more so. But just as easily impressive was her massive ass with each butt cheek larger than a bean bag chair. Barely leaving any room for her thick, fluffy tail to rest between the back of the seat and her ass.

The sight of the gorgeous, obese, crimson haired vixen before you left you feeling rubbery in the legs, short of breath, and a distinct tightening sensation in the front of your pants. Only when you politely cleared your throat did the obese fox's eyes pull way from her book to look at you in surprise. Causing you to silently suck in a breath as your eyes fell upon two, breathtaking emerald eyes that were framed perfectly by her rectangular glasses.

"This seat taken?" you asked calmly but kindly.

"Oh um, uh...no?" said the fox confusedly.

"Mind if I?" you asked, gesturing to the open booth seat.

The fat fox's eyes darted between you and the empty seat several times before she replied. "Uh, sure?"

"Thanks,"

As you scooted yourself into the seat, the vixen continued watching you with confusion and slight apprehension.

"Mind if I ask what you're reading?" you asked, pointing at her book.

With a thumb still on her page, the vixen closed the book to read the front cover. "It's called, 'The Celestial Trek',"

"Ah, the cover reminded me of a book my roommate recommended for me to read once. I was curious to see if it was the same one," you explained.

"You read science fiction?" the fox asked with genuine surprise and curiosity, adjusting her glasses and sweeping a lock of hair behind her left ear.

"Quite a bit actually," you said truthfully,"You know, alot of the classics: Asimov, Bradbury, Fredrick Brown, Arthur Clarke.....But not that one, what's it about?"

"It tells the story of a struggling human research colony inside the heart of an asteroid on the far edge of the galaxy alongside the alien locals who want to mine asteroid for space fuel,"

"Oh that's cool, does it have tentacle space-monsters and lusty, pink skinned alien queens?" you said in jest.

"Nope, it has lusty purple skinned alien kings," corrected the vixen with a smirk.

You tilted your head back with a laugh. "And how is it?" you asked excitedly.

There was a brief pause as the obese vixen removed her thumb from inside the book and carefully closed both book covers.

"Horrible," she deadpanned, setting the book down and sliding it to the edge of the table.

There was a moment of silence before the two of you burst out into a fit of giggles at the vixen's rather blunt book critique.

"That bad huh?" you asked.

"Not the worst I've read, but certainly not the greatest," she said, brushing back more of her hair, this time with the lone strand of dyed pink hair.

"The name's Leo by the way," you declared, offering out a hand.

The large vixen smiled warmly as she took your hand in hers to shake. "Felicia," she replied.

"Nice to meet you Felicia, so what are you hanging around here for?" you said, gesturing about the bar with a twirling hand. "This place isn't exactly what I would call 'ideal' for quiet reading time,"

The fox giggled with a playful roll of her eyes. "It is to me. I have to escape from my apartment every Friday night because my roommate invites all of her environmental club buddies to design posters and plan fundraisers."

"Oh that's terrifying," you grimaced with slight horror.

"Right?" Felicia replied, giggling a little into one of her hands.

"But, hey, it could be worse," you said with a shrug.

Felicia raised an eyebrow at this."What could be worse than that?"

"You could have my roommate, Mr. fashion magazine modeler and all his photography pals on photo shoot night,"

"Ha!" exclaimed the vixen.

Once more the conversation devolved into a round of joyful laughter and snickering. This went on for several minutes before you were interrupted by the tall, gray furred wolf barkeep dressed in a green plaid shirt.

"Need a refill ma'am? And something for you sir?" asked the barkeep with a bemused grin.

Both you and Felicia looked each other in the eyes. Both trying to size up the other. It was strange, the two of you had barely been speaking for ten minutes and already things were getting familiar.

"Uh," the fox began.

"One beer for myself, another for my friend here, and a plate of greasy nachos for each of us. Sound good to you?"

You directed that last comment at the obese, emerald eyed vixen whose growing smile threatened to make your heart implode.

"Sounds excellent," she replied.

-----

Nearly three hours later, you and Felicia were having a grand time there in the bar. Happily trading favorite movies and TV shows, cheesy jokes, and a few embarrassing stories from life at college. The two of you progressively getting more and more drunk and silly with each round of drinks and greasy nachos.

Well to be fair, you had had one plate of nachos so far. Felicia, on the other hand, had three and was busy destroying a fourth. She kept trying to offer to comp you the bill, but you weren't having it. You were more than content to watch the obese fox happily stuff her face with her thick tail swishing back and forth, despite the appendage being stuck between the seat and her titanic sized rear. Not to mention noticing every now and again as tiny bits of cheese, toppings, and tortilla chips would fall from her mouth and land on top of her oversized cleavage that was trying to spill out of her shirt. Perhaps it was your alcohol addled mind, but the thought of licking all that cheese off her massive, furry breasts sounded incredibly appealing. The sound of someone belching a little derailed your train of thought and pulled you back into reality.

"Ahhh, that hit the spot," Felicia said happily, licking her lips before taking a good sized swig of her beer then promptly belching once more.

"Sorry," she said, her face turning red as her hair.

To the vixen's visible surprise, you simply chuckled and flashed her a smile. "Why are you sorry? Nothing wrong with a healthy appeitie," you said gently while snatching a tortilla chip loaded with toppings from her plate.

The hefty fox sighed and leaned backwards in her seat, placing both hands on her bloated gut somberly. "Yes there is, no one should eat this much."

"I disagree, I think it's great for someone to be so comfortable with eating in today's strict society. Especially with someone with a heart and body as lovely as yooooouuuuu...." you trailed off awkwardly, your face swiftly turning pale at your accidental confession.

There was another moment of silence.

"Um, I mean....uhhh...."

"Awww thank you, I think your cute too," she said happily, closing her eyes and tilting her head a little.

You gave the large fox a goofy grin in return, but on the inside, your heart was pounding in your ears. It was becoming harder and harder to contain your growing excitement. Here you were, sitting in front of a beautiful behemoth of a vulpine with stunning eyes, a heart of gold, and with good taste in pop culture.

There had been other love interests before, both human and anthro alike, but none seemed to have come close to being the one you desired. But here, sitting with Felicia, you couldn't help but drink in every last detail about her. And there was a LOT to drink. The way she brushed back her hair as she listened to you speak, the dimples on her fat face when she smiled, the way her tree trunk thick leg comfortably rested against your skinny one under the table, the small spot of nacho cheese and beef resting on the left side of her muzzle....

Hang on a sec....

"Oh, uh, Felicia?"

"Yes?" said the fox with a giggle, her green eyes twinkling with drunken mirth.

"You got a little..." you said, pointing at your left cheek.

"Got a what?"

"Got a little food on your cheek,"

"I do?"

A small chuckle escaped your lips as you watched the vixen drunkenly place a hand on the right side of her muzzle in confusion, the alcohol clearly had robbed her of all normal brain function. Raising up slightly in your seat, you leaned over the table with a napkin in hand to help the drunk fox out. What you did next, you did without control. You just meant to help the obese vixen, a simple little courtesy.

Just politely wipe the nacho cheese and meat off her cheek and clean her fur with the napkin. Instead, you drew close enough to her pudgy face to gently lick the nacho toppings off before giving her a gentle, loving kiss on the cheek. Below you could feel the fat fox suddenly grow tense in her seat in response. Her swishing tail instantly becoming rigid and halting in it's movement. You were just about to nervously pull back to gauge her reaction, (and desperately apologize if need be), when unexpectedly....

Whenever you wanted to get away from it all, the Fireglade National Forest was the first place you come. The woods were absolutely beautiful all year round, and the hiking trails were just long and difficult enough to be a great way to stay in shape. Unfortunately, nobody else seems to share your enthusiasm. As the city grows more and more bustling and modernized, nobody is interested in the forest anymore. You hardly ever run into anyone hiking the trails, and you can never convince your friends to accompany you on your treks. The solitude can be nice, of course, but sometimes you’d appreciate having someone to talk to. Thus, you joined a weekend hiking meetup club online in the hopes of finding other people who just want to relax and enjoy nature.

You’re standing in the parking lot at the entrance to the trails, and as you sort through your wallet to pay for parking, your heart sinks when you realize there doesn’t seem to be anyone else around. You had shown up a few minutes late… could they have already started without you? Eventually, though, you spot a bear woman standing next to her car, apparently doing warm up stretches. You think you recognize her as one of the people who said they’d be coming, though you didn’t know why she was alone. Didn’t half a dozen people say they’d be coming? Still, you tentatively approached her.

The bear was sporting an incredibly, one could say, robust figure. She was an odd mix of pudgy and athletic; she had the toned, muscular arms and legs of a bodybuilder, and yet, she still had wide bulky hips, and a big round belly she proudly showed off beneath her crop top. She was so burly, she could easily be mistaken for a man if it wasn’t for her huge breasts which her sports bra could barely contain. Combined with the fact that she was solid 2 feet taller than you, and she was well and truly an imposing figure. “You’re here for the meetup, right?” She smiled widely when she sees you walk up.

“Y-yeah, sorry I’m late,” you say, a bit confused as to why there aren’t more people here.

“It’s fine. I was just worried that I might have to go it alone again,” she said. She seemed sort of excited just to see you. “Last time I came to one of these things, literally nobody else showed up.”

“That’s terrible,” you replied.

“Yeah. I guess it didn’t help that it was in february. By then, people are already giving up on their new year’s resolutions,” she said, bitterly. “Folks just don’t appreciate the great outdoors, anymore. They just get addicted to the hustle and bustle of the city. The woods are too… quiet for them.” She suddenly looks a little embarrassed. “Oh! Look at me, flapping my gums. Sorry about that. Let’s get down to brass tacks - my name’s Suanne,” she said, offering her hand.

“Vincent. Nice to meet you,” you said, reaching out to shake her hand. Once again, you were impressed by her size; her hand was almost twice as large as yours, and her powerful grip showed off her incredible strength. By the time the handshake concluded, your shoulder was sore. “You know these trails?”

“Like the back of my hand. I’ve been coming here since I moved to this town,” she grinned. You decided to grab a map, although Suanne apparently didn’t need one. “I’m feeling the Hollow Rock Falls trail today. It’s absolutely beautiful at this time of year.” That trail’s about five miles long, up and down the various slopes of the forest. A proper workout, for sure.

“Sounds good,” you nod, but stand in place, confused, when the bear starts walking towards the trail. “Hey, shouldn’t we wait for everybody else?”

She frowns, turning to you. “Trust me, hun, they’re not coming. They’re probably all lounging around on their sofas right now,” she says. “Some people just want to convince themselves they’re the outdoorsy type, but when it actually comes down to, y’know, going outside, they just come up with excuse after excuse…”

You were a bit taken aback by her cynicism, but you figure she probably has a lot more experience with this than you do. “Uh… alright,” you said, and you hesitantly followed the bear as the two of you started down the trail.

You walk in silence for a while. Even though you were walking relatively briskly, with her long stride, you knew the tall woman could easily outpace you… but she seemed to intentionally walk slowly, so the two of you were side-by-side. Eventually, she spoke up. “So, let's get this out of the way,” she said. “Tell me; do you mind me flapping my gums during our trek? I like to chit-chat while hiking, but if you just want to listen to the birds, I can totally shut up.”

“No, no, it’s fine. I mean, chatting is sorta the point of the meet up, right?” You reassure her.

“Guess so,” she shrugged. “So, ‘Vincent’. How long have you been living in Perlshaw?”

“Three years,” you reply. “Moved here from Myrefall.” Myrefall is the town with the the highest population of anthros of any town in the state. A charming town, to be sure, but the longer you lived there, the more it seemed like a dead end.

“No shit? Me too,” she nodded, surprised. “Ugh! I miss it. Such a beautiful town. You didn’t happen to go to Rutherford, did you?”

“Nope. Granite Hills.”

“Ah. My little sister went there,” she said. “She still lives over in Myrefall, actually. She sends me photos from around town all the time, and it makes me sooo jealous!” Her belly heaves as she laughs.

“Hm,” you mumble, thoughtfully. “So… are you not liking it in Perlshaw?”

“Um. I mean, I don’t hate it here, but it wouldn’t have been my first choice. Just doesn’t feel like home, you know?” She said. “I don’t dislike humans, of course, but I don’t really seem to fit in with them. They always seem a tad nervous around big gals like me.”

“Huh. Well, I get along pretty well with humans, I guess. Pretty much all my friends are humans, at this point,” you reply, “but it can get annoying to always feel like the odd one out, just cause I’m a fox. I’m usually their only anthro friend, so they always treat me like I’m some kind of novelty, you know?” The dating pool was also quite limited, too, though you opted not to mention that.

“Oooh! I know exactly what you’re talking about!”

For the next hour or so, your hike continued on in much the same way, the two of you making small talk and learning a bit about eachother while you both enjoyed the same outdoors. As the two of you became more familiar, you couldn’t help but notice Suanne’s stories slowly getting a little more raunchy. And there was one ‘topic’ in particular that always seemed to come up:
1332222.title: Suanne the Grizzly Bear

13322222.content:
The stories she told seemed to all involve food somehow. Additionally, during her stories, it wasn’t uncommon for her to go off on a long tangent describing what she ate that day, in excruciating detail. You knew grizzly bears are said to be obsessed with food, but you always figured that was just a stereotype. At one point, after a full minute of her describing the juicy taste of some hot dogs she had at a barbecue, you interrupted her. “You really like hotdogs, huh?”

She chuckled. “Are you kidding me? I’ll have you know I was the national hot dog eating champion of 2015.”

“... the what?”

“You know what an eating contest is?” You nod. “Well, a few years back, your’s truly won the heavyweight hot dog eating national championship! And my competitor in the finals was a hippopotamus, too, so I really had to give it my all. To win, I ended up having to eat hundreds of hotdogs in ten minutes, buns and all.”

“Jeez! Hundreds?” You almost gasped in disbelief. After all, she wasn’t even that overweight. She had a fair share of blubber on her, but overall, she was pretty fit. Then again, she was pretty large, at a little less than 8 feet tall. “How did you do that?”

“I just shoved, like, a dozen of them in my mouth at a time and swallowed them. After two hundred or so, I already felt like I was about to pop. But the way that smug hippo gloated… I just knew I couldn’t let her win! So I just kept eating faster, and faster...” She excitedly recalled the story. “When I heard them ring the bell, it was like I snapped out of a trance. I looked down, and my belly was like… this big!” She hovers her hands a solid 8 inches or so over her gut, and you shiver as you imagine what her round belly must’ve looked like stretched out so large.

“Wow. Were you, like... okay?” You raise a brow. That just couldn’t be healthy.

“Oh, yeah. I just had to nap all weekend, and I was right as rain,” she nods. “I didn’t even gain much weight! I’m a carnivore, you know, so I’ve got a pretty powerful metabolism. To maintain this size, for example, I need to eat at least, like, 20,000 calories a day.” You nod, thoughtfully. For some strange reason, you were fascinated by the bear describing all the food she eats. “It gets especially bad during the fall. Like, even though I don’t hibernate, I still feel the urge to eat as much as I can, you know? It’s, like, primitive.”

“How do you afford all that?” You ask.

“It’s not that expensive to buy meat in bulk,” she laughs. “I mean, if you think I eat a lot, you should read up on how much elephants eat. Or whales!” She starts rambling something about elephants, but at this point, you were hardly listening. For some reason, you were feeling a little… ‘excited’. You didn’t know if it was just because this was the first anthro woman you’ve talked to in months or what, but more and more, you’re catching yourself staring at the bear woman’s beautiful body. But you weren’t ogling her sizeable chest or round hips; for some reason, you were more interested in her belly. You’ve never really been in to larger woman, but for some reason, she was suddenly striking you as gorgeous. Of course, to avoid looking like a total creep, you kept this to yourself.

“Oh, hey, here’s a funny story. So my sister dabbles in gardening, and she wanted to go to a harvest festival a couple weeks ago to show off some of her veggies. And I came too, cause, like, free food, right?” She says as she walks along. “She was so excited for the festival, but there was one rabbit guy that was just ruining it for her. You see, apparently, if left alone, watermelons just never stop growing. Just get bigger and bigger till they die. So this guy had this crazy, huge, one hundred pound watermelon, and he treated that damn thing like it was his child. It was, like, the thing he was most proud of on Earth.”

“Really? A watermelon?” You chuckle, raising a brow.

“I know, right? Anyway, he was showing it off to everyone, as if he was hot shit just cause he watered a fruit for a while. I could tolerate that… but then he started badmouthing everyone else. Almost made my sister cry when she called her zucchinis too small,” she explains. “At that point, I was seeing red, right? So before I even knew what I was doing, I grabbed that damn watermelon straight out of his hands, and swallowed it whole!” She starts laughing uproariously at the memory, while you stare at her, uncertain whether or not she was serious.

“You swallowed it?” You asked. “Like, the whole thing?”

“Yup! All in one gulp,” she smiles. “That dude absolutely freaked out, cause God forbid anyone harm his precious watermelon. He even tried to reach down my throat and grab it! Which, needless to say, got him kicked out by security.”

“Heh! That’s crazy…” You chuckle nervously. You don’t know why the thought of the bear swallowing such a huge meal whole was exciting to you, nor the thought of a rabbit reaching his arms down her cavernous throat. You really didn’t know what you were feeling right now, but for some reason, there was a question you just had to ask. “Could you have swallowed him, too?” You ask, making it sound like you were joking, although you were genuinely morbidly curious.

“Oh, yeah, easily,” she nods nonchalantly, as if that was the most normal thing in the world. “It was almost hard not to, with the way he was practically crawling down my throat.”

“O-oh…” You said, your heart sinking in your chest. Was she really capable of swallowing entire people? Why the hell did that excite you so much? You wanted to drop the subject completely… but there was something you just had to know. “Yeah, well… he’s a rabbit. They’re pretty bite sized, I guess,” you say, trying to sound natural. “I mean, you wouldn’t be able to swallow me, right?”

Your eyes widen as she given you a big, toothy grin, her lips spreading to show her sharp, white fangs. You only realize now just how huge her mouth is. “Well, that depends, hun. Would you want me to?” She starts laughing at the look on your face, giving you a clear view down her dark throat.

You try to snap out of your trance. “Uhh! W-well, I mean, uh, ah… n-no! Of course not!” You stutter assertively, swiftly walking ahead of her to hide the growing tent in your pants. “Never in a million years! W-why would you even ask?”

Her face softens down to a warm smile. “Relax! I’m just messing with ya,” she chuckled, giving you a light, playful punch in the arm. You took a deep breath, trying to calm down and wipe that conversation from your mind. “Now, enough of me yammering on. Why don’t you tell me about yourself? You’ve been quiet this whole walk.”

Having cooled down a bit, you sigh and turn back to her. “What do you want to know?”

“Uh...” She asks. “Well, what brought you to Perlshaw?”

The story of how you came here was quite a...

14311212.title: Sarah's love options, part 2

143112121.content:
Thud!

With a grumble you raised your head back off of your desk, rubbing your forehead. Going through the reams of paperwork before you was proving about as thrilling as watching a competition between paint drying and grass growing. The rampant heat wasn’t helping matters either; you had the front door open to let in the slight breeze to the front of the store, but that did little to cool you in the cramped office-cum-storage room at the back. You had come back here to get away from the constant cacophony of a busy city day – vehicles grumbling, people shouting, numerous songs pouring from all directions – but you were starting to think that may have not been such a great idea; at least out there, the noise might have kept you awake. Blinking your eyes several times, you tried to focus on the order sheet in front of you again.

You just started to reach for your pen when you had to stop and adjust your shirt. You thought you had struck a compromise between comfort and professionalism, but now you were thinking that you might have swung a bit too far from the comfort end anyways. The garment clung to your body due to the heat, which only further added to your discomfort. The sticking was especially prevalent around your bust, but considering how many of your tops were already tight around your weighty breasts, it wasn’t too surprising. In the shadow of your breasts though, your belly wasn’t spared either, but that may have had more to do with how it was more than bit doughy now. In truth, your weight had been steadily creeping up ever since even before you took over Alexander’s Literary Emporium from the previous owner and your former boss, Bravon Alexander.

You started working here partway through high school and continued with the job through college, when Bravon announced that he would be retiring and wanted to know if you wanted the store. All of those late nights of study and eating mostly fast food had left your already above average hourglass shape even curvier. But the addition of sitting around most every day going through the paperwork had started to turn your weight gains up to eleven. You wouldn’t consider yourself fat by any means yet, but you were definitely heading past the curvy stage and closing in on it. While you thought you might have been more concerned about this by now, to your surprise you actually sort of liked it.

You long dexterous fingers played with your pen between filling out the papers at the top of the stack. You were so engrossed that you practically jumped out of your skin when a loud shout was followed by a tremendous clatter. Hopping out of your seat you ran through the connecting door into the store proper, wondering the whole time what had happened. Darting along the aisles, you soon found the cause of the commotion: a dragoness standing near a pile of fallen books. You froze in your tracks upon seeing her, briefly stunned by her beauty.
143112121.title: One hot day

choices: The dragoness has been patiently waiting for you.
Somehow, you managed to get there before the dragoness.
1431121212.content:
It was obvious what happened: her extra wide hips had brushed into one of the shelves of books, taking out practically the whole row and dumping them into a pile on the floor. A portion of your mind was able to figure this out, but far more of your mental sharpness had fled you as your thoughts focused almost entirely on the dragoness before you. Her hips were truly stupendous, looking more that easily wide enough that you wouldn’t be able to wrap your arms around just one and touch on the other side, and you could easily see her mammoth rump even though she was facing towards you. Her stomach dropped down across her thighs and extended far enough out that she probably hadn’t seen her toes without looking in a mirror in a very long time. You kept getting drawn to her breasts though, each a luscious fleshy orb distended under their own weight, pooling atop her stomach.

She was obviously very confident in her weight as well, not burying her body beneath layers upon layers of clothes despite the heat, she instead was wearing a top that was loose and flowing but still displayed her myriad curves and had a plunging neckline that exposed nearly a handspan of the canyon of her cleavage, while the sleeves only covered the rounded flesh of her upper arm, leaving her meaty lower arms exposed. Her legs on the other hand were packed into calf-length jeans that just served to emphasize her rump and hips. Her face looked gorgeous with luminous jade colored eyes, plump lips, and just a hint of makeup—in your opinion, she didn’t look like she needed much if any makeup. All in all, you found that she looked stunning even despite how distressed she looked about knocking some of the product to the ground.

“Come on boss, we should help her out,” you heard someone say, finally piercing the veil around your mind.

Only now did you realize that you had been staring at her, though no one seemed to have noticed. What felt like an eternity to you had apparently only been a few scant seconds. Shaking your head to clear the cobwebs, you saw that it was Marcus, the young man that worked the register up front. The mop headed blond started to move past you, but you saw someone waiting to check out, the fox somewhat distracted by the commotion. You directed him to head up and help that customer out, while you stayed here. You weren’t about to pass up a chance like this.

You took a moment to try and get your breathing under control as well as to help focus so you wouldn’t start staring again. Once settled as much as you could, you quickly stepped closer. The dragoness quickly apologized for the accident, though you briefly got another thrill from how sweet and musical her voice sounded to you. Giving another quick shake of your head, you told her that it was just an accident, and one that was easily fixed. The two of you quickly started to pick the books up, though you also spent some time organizing them as well. You kept getting distracted each time the dragoness would bend over; facing towards you, her breasts nearly spilled out of her top, tempting you with their obvious softness, and when she was facing away from you her butt was often displayed directly at you, almost as if inviting you to bury your hands in the bulging expanse. It was all you could do to push the thoughts aside and keep yourself as composed as possible.

Close to the end, you were sorting more of the books on the shelf with the dragoness watching you, when she tucked a stray lock of her long red hair behind her ear. She then asked, “Do you work here or something?”

“Something like that. I’m the owner,” you responded, glancing sideways at her, where you saw such a blush spread across her face.

“Oh no! I’m sorry about all this. I feel like such a klutz: I come into this lovely little store and knock half of it the ground, and then the owner has to help the whale clean up.” She buried her head in her hands.

“Hey, like I said before it was an accident and look…we’re done cleaning up already,” you soothed her, sliding the last book into place.

“Well, I suppose it wasn’t too bad, but it still feels like I should do something to make up for the trouble.”

“Well…maybe…would you like to go out for a cup of coffee?” you managed to say without betraying too much anticipation in your voice.

She arched an eyebrow at that. “A coffee…? In this heat?” Now it was your turn to blush, while you tried to come up with something else to say. She beat you to the punch though and continued, “How about this instead: I’ve got to get going right now, but maybe we could go out and have dinner tonight…please, it would be my treat. Think of it as a way for me to make up for causing this mess and making you clean it all up”

It took every ounce of willpower not to let your mouth drop open in shock. This wonderful looking woman was asking you out, what incredible luck. You managed to stammer out “Sure.”

She smiled, almost reducing you to a puddle on the floor. “All right, you know the restaurant over on 5th; it’s at the end near the boardwalk.” You nodded before she continued, “Why don’t we meet up there say around eight-ish?” Again, you nodded. “See you then I suppose.” She smiled again before turning and walking away, giving you a fantastic view of the twin hills of her butt bobbing up and down like two massive metronomes set in direct opposition to each other. Her long and thick tail almost caught on another bookcase, but she managed to avoid it this time instead resulting in what you thought of as a playful slap across you. She walked up to the register and paid for a pile of books that you hadn’t seen her grab, too focused on her. When she went outside into the broiling heat, the dragoness met up with someone else, a slender cheetah that had been waiting more than a little impatiently, busy on her phone nearly the whole time.

“Was that you making all that noise earlier?” the cheetah asked. You didn’t hear all the dragoness’ response, just a bit about knocking some books off the shelf, but the other spoke up again, “God, Vanessa Golde knocking over something yet again.”

The two of them continued to talk but quickly passed beyond you being able to hear anything except the busy city street. You had lost the ability to understand anyways, too lost in whirling thoughts based on the name that the cheetah had said; surely the dragoness couldn’t be that Vanessa Golde, right?

You recovered a short time later, dismissing any thoughts about who this Vanessa Golde was, and returned to your work. The rest of the day passed in a heady blur, unable to keep images of the dragoness from floating through your mind. After closing the shop at seven, you dashed back home and quickly showered before changing clothes. The Night Rose wasn’t an ultra formal restaurant, but it also wasn’t exactly a place to wear sweat soaked semi-casual wear either. You opted for a loose flowing blouse with just the top two buttons undone, and a knee length skirt that hugged your plush cheeks. By this time, you were cutting it close to get back to the restaurant, so you went as fast as you could – and maybe even a little beyond at times – to try and get there. Unfortunately, due to traffic congestion as well as construction, it was closing in on nine by the time that you got parked and darted for the restaurant. The day’s heat had thankfully broken, and there was a cool breeze sweeping in from off of the water making it a relatively pleasant night.
1431121212.title: A chance encounter

choices: She believes you for some reason.
She doubts you, but she’s willing to give you a chance.
14311212121.content:
It seemed like half the city if not more had come down to take advantage of the cooling air down along the coastline. You pressed through the heaving crowds, eyes flicking every direction in the hopes of finding her. Then, as if by magic, a slight opening appeared and through it you saw the dragoness. She made a space for herself at the railing overlooking the pounding surf below. Seeing her standing there made you feel more than a little underdressed. The dragoness looked magnificent in a flowing dress that managed to highlight her every curve.

The opening started to close up again as the people continued on their way around you. You managed to force your way through. She didn’t seem to notice you at first, and instead went on staring out across the waves.

“Sorry, I’m late,” you stammered out, hoping your voice was loud enough for her to hear.

It must have been as she turned to look at you with a smile curling her lips. “Oh, there you are, miss bookstore.” You started to ramble on about the traffic and everything, hoping beyond belief that she would accept your explanation. She cut you off though, “It’s not a problem. I understand.” Even those words in her voice sent your heart aflutter. “Come along now though, I’m starting to get a bit hungry.”

With that she started to move off. You happened to notice the two hotdog papers she threw away when she thought you couldn’t see them. You gave no sign that you saw that, but wondered how hungry she could be after that.

The dragoness plunged through the crowd with far more ease then you experienced. You were able to follow right along by keeping to the wake that she opened. No matter how much you tried, you couldn’t keep your eyes away from that bobbing rump before you, taunting and tempting you with every step she took.

Her path soon led to The Night Rose, the namesake rose depicted on a star speckled sign above the door. Only a few moments later, the two of you ended up seated in a secluded booth. You didn’t complain at all when she asked to move the table more your direction. Even before she sat down, you could see how her girth would have ended up flowing onto the table. She asked you a bit about the bookstore and how you liked working there. You did have to comment that you hated all of the paperwork that became a necessity. After some further small talk as you both looked over the menu, the waiter came by.

You were about to open your mouth when the dragoness got in first. She rattled off quite a list of food: a steak with mashed potatoes, pork chops on a bed of rice, along with a salad with chicken. Then she turned to you and asked what you wanted. You were stunned for several seconds. She had the hot dogs a short while ago, and then she was going to order all that? Your heart thundered in your chest, you didn’t think she could get any better. You shook it off though, and placed an order for a bowl of shrimp scampi with pasta. The waiter gave a quick nod before returning to the kitchen.

Looking back at the dragoness, you noticed she had a blush creeping into her cheeks and she was fidgeting with her hair. “I hope I didn’t scare you with how much I ordered.”

Your throat went dry. “Scare me? No, not at all,” you admitted.

She seemed rather unconvinced, but let the matter drop. As quiet settled between the two of you again, you started to hear some of the comments drifting around your booth.

“Did you see that whale of a dragon go by?”

“I hope there’s enough food left in the kitchen after she gets done.”

“How could she let herself go like that? And why is she even going out?”

You grit your teeth, and now realized that you had heard similar derogatory comments during your time behind her on the boardwalk. Too lost in the sight before you, you hadn’t registered you heard them till now. Bringing your attention back to the table, you found your dinner companion fiddling with her drink glass, looking like she wasn’t paying any attention to the words around her. Then you saw the tightness of her face and she kept her eyes planted on the table beside her.

“You look very pretty tonight,” you blurted out, regretting how stupid you sounded as soon as the words let your mouth.

Her gaze snapped up to you, her eyelids fluttering. “Th-thank you,” she said at last, a slight smile on her lips, though there was something that said she didn’t believe you.

You were about to say something else, but the food arrived. The dragoness’s smile became wide and genuine as she took in the feast before her. You twirled some of the pasta and speared a shrimp, bringing it to your mouth. The forkful froze as you took in the sight before you. The dragoness was like a machine, moving fast but without any wasted effort. Food vanished into her mouth, without a spilled drop or crump escaping her gnashing teeth. All of her worries seemed to be so far away as she demolished the steak and potatoes before moving onto the pork chops on their bed of rice.

You forced yourself to tear your eyes away, and focus on your own meal. It didn’t last long though as you returned to staring at the dragoness. On and on she went, more and more food vanishing down her throat with such practiced speed and ease. Despite already well past the point that most people would have been sick to their stomach, she continued to eat. She even made sure each plate and bowl was left without a trace of the food that once graced them.

In the end, she sat back with a burp escaping her lips. Then she seemed to come back into herself. Her face went beet red as she looked up at you before burying her face in her hands.

“Oh no!” she cried. “I’m sorry you had to see that! I shouldn’t have ordered that much and I definitely shouldn’t have eaten everything.”

“What are you talking about?” you sputtered, glancing around in the hopes the two of you weren’t making as big a scene as you thought you were. Unfortunately, there were plenty of eyes turned towards your booth. Nothing you could do about that though.

She went on, “This was supposed to be a nice little dinner to repay you for the trouble at your bookstore, and then I had to ruin it. Letting my stomach get the better of me.”

“You didn’t ruin it. I like–” you started to say before you clamped a hand to your mouth.

“You what?” she asked, moist looking eyes boring into you.

Your face burned. You were sure she could see the blush through the fur on your face, but there was no going back now. “I liked it,” you admitted, and then the words started to spill from your mouth. “When I first saw you, I thought you were gorgeous, and my opinion hasn’t exactly faded after seeing you eat like that.”

145221211.title: A furry love

choices: She’s tall and very well muscled.
1452212111.content:
It was never going to be an ordinary day. You knew something was going to happen when you got up; you just weren’t sure what it was. You went about your daily rituals anyways before checking on the painting you had worked on the day before. It hadn’t dried yet.

You next grabbed a quick breakfast before hopping on your computer. There were a few emails from various galleries, including those that had some of your work on display as well as some that showed some interest in doing so as well. Your heart skipped a beat when you saw one from Jade. Jade Campbell started out as just another online purchaser of some of your paintings, but developed into something much more.

Messages, emails, and calls had passed back and forth between the two of you since she first contacted you. Standard questions about one of your pieces shifted to include interest in several others, before taking on a much more personal content. Despite the connection that had formed between the two of you, you had never actually seen her, not even in a picture. She was also reluctant to describe herself in any specific way. From the small bits you managed to piece together, you got the sense that she may have felt embarrassed by herself in some way.

It seemed that she had perhaps overcome that though. According to her latest message, the bovine was ready to meet with you in person. She was inviting you downtown to a restaurant that you had only seen in passing. She apologized for the short notice, but hoped that you could have some time to do it tonight.

The thought of meeting her was more than a little thrilling. The next thought you had was that you didn’t have anything that would be suitable for such a place. You fired off a response confirming that you wanted to have dinner with her. Then you wolfed down the rest of your cereal, before getting dressed in a hurry and rushing out the door.

Hours later, you slipped in through the door at Solitude with only a few minutes to spare. The host gave you a once over as you walked in. It was obvious that the bear was thinking that you looked out of place. Your new dress hugged your curves in a wonderful fashion, but it was clear to anyone that you were not used to wearing such finery. His demeanor brightened when you managed to say that you were here to meet Jade.

He led you through the door beside him and into the main part of the restaurant. It looked like you were expecting: dark wood paneling, cozy and subdued lighting, and plenty of high class decorations in every direction. You couldn’t help but gawk at the wealth on display around you. You were doing reasonably well selling your paintings, but you never had a chance to ever come to a place like this on your own.

A worrying thought kept popping up no matter how much you tried to swat it away: what if she was planning to try sticking you with a bill you had no chance of paying? You shook your head; no, Jade wasn’t like that…or at least you didn’t hope so.

Your worrying was shoved aside as the bear stopped at a secluded booth tucked away out of view of most of the rest of the restaurant. “Your guest has arrived, madam,” he said to someone out of your view behind the wall of the booth.

“Oh, thank you, William,” Your breath caught in your throat as you heard that voice. It was the voice you had heard so many times before, imagining who was on the other end of the line.

“Your table, ma’am,” William said while motioning towards the table before retracting his steps back the other way.

You ran your hands down across your dress, making sure that there wasn’t any major wrinkles and whatnot. Then you turned towards your hair, done up in an unfamiliar braid. You didn’t want to find it caught in the dress or anything like that.

You almost jumped out of your skin when Jade asked, “Alexandra, are you there?”

“Yeah,” you managed to croak back. Clearing your throat, you tried again, “Yeah, I’m here.”

Wait, did she sound nervous too? you wondered. There was something to her voice.

Another shake of your head, dismissing that thought. Satisfied that you weren’t a complete mess, you took a deep breath before stepping forward around the edge of the booth. Jade looked at you with a smile as she saw you. It was brief, but you were sure the smile looked a bit tight for a moment. You hoped she found you at least halfway decent because you thought she looked downright gorgeous.
1452212111.title: Heading downtown

choices: …there was a loud commotion from the kitchen.
14522121111.content:
“Ah, there you are, Alex,” the cow sitting in the booth said with a wide smile as she tucked away a small book.

“Yep, here I am,” you replied with a half-stifled nervous laugh. You regretted it in an instant, wishing you hadn’t sounded so stupid.

Jade gave a quick glance up and down across you. She might have thought you wouldn’t notice in the dim light and shadows, but you always did have great eyesight even in the dark.

“You pictures didn’t do you justice,” she said after finishing her appraisal. “They were superb naturally, but are nothing compared to seeing you in person.”

Partway through your correspondence, you built up the nerve to send a few pictures to Jade. You hoped that might help encourage the cow to do the same back. It hadn’t worked out that way of course.

“Thank you,” you stammered as you took your seat across from her. You tried in vain to smooth any wrinkles that formed from that act.

“Think nothing of it,” she said with a wave of her hand, and that smile still curling her lips.

She then busied herself with taking a drink from her water glass. You took this chance to check the curvy cow out yourself. Hair as dark as the midnight sky except for a blue forelock fell around a face that you thought was quite model worthy. The most striking aspect f her face was the dazzling eyes, each a luminous green orb that shone like expert cut emeralds. Her hair continued to spill in thick waves around shoulders bared by her dress. While you felt and looked out of sorts wearing your dress, Jade wore hers like a second skin.

You had no doubt in your mind that someone had done a spectacular job of tailoring the dress to suit her so well. The sparkling fabric highlighted the gorgeous black and white fur that the dress shown around the dress. It hugged weighty breasts and exposed a tasteful glimpse of what you thought to be a fantastic amount of cleavage. You couldn’t see them due to the table now, but you knew from your first view of her that her dress flared around hips were sure to be exquisite. A small part of your mind imagined what her butt had to be like. Meanwhile between the top and bottom of her hourglass lay a plush belly peeking between the overshadowing bust and thighs.

In short, you found Jade to be breathtaking. Far better than the worst fears your mind continued to dwell on no matter how much you tried to fight them away. She was even better than you had hoped of dreaming of.

“And how is your latest painting coming, Alex?” Jade asked, snapping you back out of your mind.

“F-fine, its fine. Checked it this morning, hadn’t dried yet. Came out looking better than I was hoping. Wasn’t sure that the shade of blue I used was quite right, but it seems to have worked out.”

“Marvelous,” she responded with another smile that sent your heart aflutter. “What’s this one again? A forest scene, yes?”

You nodded and doe into a bit of an explanation, feeling a bit more at ease talking about your art. Jade listened with rapt attention that broken only when a waiter came by with a bottle of what you thought looked like a very expensive wine. The tidy young man let Jade check the bottle over before pouring her a bit to sample. When she expressed her satisfaction, he proceeded to provide the both of you with some. He left the two of you alone again as soon as he finished. You never had much experience with wine before, but found the taste rather pleasant even so.

The conversation soon picked up where it left ff. After that came Jade expressing her admiration for the paintings she already purchased. She had already done this but admitted that she wished to repeat them in person now that she could. You couldn’t prevent the blush that crept into your cheeks as she went on.

The return of the waiter brought an abrupt end to her continuing praise. He asked “Ms. Campbell” if she would like her usual. You almost missed it, but still managed to pick up the slight hesitation before she agreed. She also seemed to drop her eyes to the table during that quick moment. You shook any concern about that as you felt buoyed by the wait staff knowing her name and order. This added a strike against your earlier paranoia. You stumbled over your words when the young man turned to you, too lost in your own head. Jade let out a delightful sounding giggle as you scanned the little menu and gave your own order.

After the waiter nodded and left, Jade returned to complimenting your previous paintings. The conversation soon turned to possibilities for your next work. You admitted that you didn’t have much idea yet, but expressed hope that inspiration would strike. You said this even though you thought that inspiration was sitting right across from you.

More small talk followed after this. You couldn’t lie; you were enjoying being with Jade very much. You were hard pressed to think of a time when you enjoyed yourself even more, even with those worries nagging at the back of your head. Jade seemed to be having a good time as well. Even still there seemed to be something nagging at her. You couldn’t quite put your finger on it, but your earlier thought that she was somehow embarrassed about herself seemed the piece most likely to fit. You hoped that the embarrassment wasn’t about meeting you at last instead. That concern continued to eat away at you until…
